headline: Easy Apple Cider
description: This easy apple cider recipe flavored with cinnamon, whole cloves, and allspice is made in a slow cooker to keep it warm for as long as it lasts!
name: Easy Apple Cider

recipeInstructions.text: Combine apple cider and cinnamon sticks in a slow cooker.

Place allspice and cloves onto the center of an 8-inch square piece of cheesecloth. Gather edges of the cheesecloth together and tie to secure; place in the slow cooker. Stir in brown sugar. Cook on High until it comes to a boil. Reduce heat to Low and keep warm.

review.reviewBody: Omitted brown sugar and allspice; cut two small oranges in half and stuck cloves in them. Boiled cider, oranges and cinnamon sticks for one-hour then warmed until serving.
Made it for my staff's annual holiday potluck. I added apple slices while it cooked. Then, I added whipped topping, caramel drizzle, and ground cinnamon as a topper. Staff LOVED it!!
I donâ€™t even like cider but this was AMAZING!!!
I added a little orange rind zest. However the recipe is excellent. I just never give 5 stars, even to my own self.

You have to wonder about the people that rated this low weather or not they actually followed the directions. I followes the recipe then added 1 sliced orange and 1 sliced apple while it simmered all day! It tasted SOOO good!
I loved this cider but can't find whole allspice so had to use ground and do some sifting. Froze it. Good to thaw it and heat it for a winter get together crowd
Very easy and good! Made with regular apple juice and added 2 slices of orange
This was great & will make again! I didn't put any additional sugar in this batch and it was still really good!

I made this the first time with ground spices because I didn't have whole ones. The second time I made it, I used the whole spices. Both versions turned out equally well. It didn't have cheesecloth so I used my large tea diffuser with good results. Both times I had it in my crockpot for 3 hours on high.
Simple, easy and yummy. I liked that it didn't attack my throat like some spiced ciders do. That might just be a 'me' thing BTW.
This is so easy, and it tastes wonderful. Put in a crockpot and we sipped all day. Also added Butterscotch Schnapps and Spiced Rum to my cup. Just the Rum is sufficient.

This was a hit on my Christmas Eve Brunch. I used a regular Gallon Apple Cider you buy at a supermarket. And after reading some of the reviews, I did not add any sugar on this one & was glad I did. The cider was already so sweet even without that sugar. Next time, I will try to use the coffee filter with ties trick. Thanks for sharing your recipe & Merry Christmas!
Very good and so easy, everyone loved it! Will making ittwice for Cheistmas, once Christmas eve for my side of the family and again for Christmas day for my husband's side.
Very good, perfect for the holidays!! I read the recipes and cut back on the brown sugar but then didn't find it quite sweet enough. Next time I will use the amount called for in the recipe.
I liked it...I might not put in as much brown sugar next time.

Absolutely delicious!! I am not a fan of Apple cider but bought some for a pork recipe I wanted to try and had leftover cider. I decided to make this and was so glad I did. Quick, easy & delicious. My entire family loved it , kids included (ages 4 & 5), as we took our hot mugs and sat by our outside fire pit. I even added a half shot of rum to my husbands which was out of this world yummy!!! I made the recipe exactly as written. No changes needed. Thank you!
This apple cider was very good. Everyone loved it.

First time I've ever tried making apple cider, and what a HIT!! Whata super base recipe. Everybody really enjoyed it, and there were no leftovers between 5 people :o . The only slight changes I made was using about 3/4 tsp of nutmeg because I didn't have allspice, and I didn't have cheesecloth either, so I put spices in a coffee filter, and tied it up. By the reviews, I added far less brown sugar (less than a 1/4 cup). Also, I added a little bit of orange peel to the cider directly, and served with a slice of orange. Delicious!! I don't like to rate a recipe after making lots of changes, but I really believe most of these spices are quite interchangeable, and the sugar can be added according to personal tastes, without affecting this base of a recipe. Will definitely make again!
I have made this apple cider several times around Thanksgiving and it has always been a hit. I followed the recipe and made no changes and it was perfect. Highly recommended and so easy to make!

I used this apple cider in a cupcake recipe and they came out perfect! 

Spiced Apple Cider Cupcakes: 
http://jordiecakes.weebly.com/blog/spiced-apple-cider-cupcakes
There were only 2 of us so I only made a third of the recipe. I have to say, it was very nice to sip on this cold evening. Didn't change a thing.

Made this for a party and everyone raved about it. I used a mesh tea ball instead of cheese cloth and substituted maple syrup for the brown sugar. I also used two 50 oz jars of cider, which seemed good in proportion to the amount of syrup. It was sweet and delicious but not overly sweet. It was so perfect having it in the crockpot where it could stay warm for hours and was easily accessible. I will definitely make this again.

This is a great recipe, I have been making my apple cider this way for years! It has always been a success. The recipe I use calls for 1/4 to 1/2 cup brown sugar so I've usually stuck with the 1/3 cup measurement. While I think it's just perfect, we all have different tastes so start with a smaller amount of sugar first, you can always add more later. My favorite way to make this is in the slow cooker... it keeps for hours and the whole house smells amazing!! If there are any leftovers, I just let them cool to room temperature and then pour it into a pitcher and store in the fridge. Just heat up mugs of cider individually and it tastes just as good... and fyi, it even tastes good cold!

Spicy and tangy. I used the powdered version of the spices and let them just free float in the cider while cooking... then used cheesecloth to strain out the excess before serving. This made the flavor super rich.
This turned out great! I didn't have a cheesecloth and just put the spices in without and they were easy to avoid when filling drinks.
very easy, very good apple cider. Just added all the ingredients - added extra cloves and allspice and put it direct in cider - winner with all those who had it

This apple cider recipe is easy and very potluck friendly. I also agree that the leftover cider is good cold or reheated. One thing I like about this recipe is I can prep the spices at home and place the brown sugar in a baggie and then prepare this at the potluck or family dinner. Iâ€™ve traveled 130+ miles with the ingredients and what a hit this was with the family. This recipe is easy, travels well and scrumptious. Happy Cooking & Baking!

We had a bonfire and I made this recipe. It was so easy! I did it on the stovetop and doubled it, using a gallon. I used crushed cloves instead of whole cloves. And it was perfect! I got so many compliments. Thank you!
Very yummy, but once it boils, take out the allspice so that the flavoring doesn't get too strong.

Great, easy Recipe! I have made this all winter and my husband drinks it all right up! I reduced the brown sugar to 1/4 cup because it was a little strong for him. I used ground cinnamon instead of buying cinnamon sticks using the conversion of 1/2 teaspoons of ground cinnamon to one stick. Also, I used ground allspice instead of the whole just because it is what I had bought. I still added a just one teaspoon of the ground allspice. Came out perfect!
This was very good! I could not find whole allspice so I used cheesecloth for the ground stuff. Well received at a work event I brought it too. Thanks!

Made this last night and tonight! Soooooo good. It's addictive and definitely helps put you in that warm and comfy Holiday mood! Was the perfect addition to our Halloween Haunted House meeting and tonight's family gathering for decorating the house! I will definitely be making this recipe for years to come! Thank you so much for sharing xoxoxoxo
This was great! Did not need quite as much brown sugar because the cider is so sweet by itself. Had a home made flavor.
Super easy! Super yummy! I was sick a couple of days and tired of drinking tea. This was a perfect alternative, and the house smelled great!
too sweet, but good otherwise. Nice spices.

I cut this in half but I kept the spices the same. This was a little sweet for me but my husband thought it was perfect. GREAT with a jigger or two of Fireball cinnamon whiskey as a fill in for hot toddy as my husband and I seem to have caught the Death Cold. Next time, I'll add the peel of one orange like the submitter suggested. I think I'll make this again tomorrow!
I too cut back the brown sugar and it tasted great.

This was great for a chilly evening fall party!! I didn't have allspice so I used ground cinnamon, nutmeg, and cloves with the cinnamon sticks. I was sooo good my kids have asked for it many times!!! Way TOO EASY to throw together for fab reviews!!!

I made this to serve at my cookie exchange, and everyone seemed to enjoy it. I made no changes other than to double the recipe. The only thing that would make this drink even better is some spiced rum.
Very easy and it makes the house smell so good. Perfect for a holiday party!!
its good, but doesn't need the sugar
Added apple and orange wedges mainly for appearance. Very good, always a hit.
Exactly as stated - easy! Very tasty too, a great way to spice things up!
Excellent easy recipe. I made it for my son's birthday party. It was a big hit with the adults.
Very good! I brought it with us when we visited some friends, and they absolutely loved it. It was too sweet, so I would only use half the sugar called for, if any at all.
Loved it! I ended up adding more spices to kick it up but as is this is a wonderful recipe!
I would suggest leaving out the sugars

Took this to the Christmas party for my kids' daycare, and everyone loved it -- both kids and adults! So easy and so good. Definitely a keeper. I didn't have cheesecloth, so I used a coffee filter held closed with a rubber band, and it worked perfectly.

My uncle could not keep himself away from my crock pot christmas day :-) I did add a sliced orange and apple to the mix and I did not use the cheese cloth for the spices, I just let them float freely......SO YUMMY!!
Pretty good. I use this recipe to make vinegar.

Great with a little bit of vanilla and nutmeg too. Works just as well with ground allspice and/or cloves if that's all you have on hand. I made this for all my holiday parties. Serve with spiced rum or vodka.

I made this for Thanksgiving, and plan on making on Christmas... I only had 32oz of cidar, but I kept the spices the same because I simmered it in a pan for an hour instead of a crock pot. I reduced the sugar to 2 Tbs. Also, I didn't have cheese cloth, so I let the cinn sticks float around, and put the other spices in a tea ball. This makes the house smell great too!

This was very good. Tastes like apple pie. I did not have whole allspice so I just threw in a teaspoon of ground allspice. I would suggest tasting the cider before adding any sugar. Mine was perfect with out it.
Made this for a holiday potluck and got rave reviews and an empty crockpot

This was very good! When my parents came home from work they said that the house smelled so good! Even my brother liked it, and he hardly ever likes anything that I make. But I had to alter the measurements because of the amount of cider that I used; I had 33 fluid ounces instead of 64, so I used 3/4 tsp of groud cinnamon, 2/3 tsp of ground allspice, 2/3 tsp of ground cloves and 1 tbsp of brown sugar. I put the allspice and cloves into a coffe filter tied with string, just as another reviewer suggested.

Yum :) After reading the other reviews, I cut back on the sugar by a lot (1 tbsp for 4 servings) because as someone pointed out, people could still add sugar to taste. It was still really sweet! So I give it 4 stars (more like 3.5) because that amount seems high.

I love this recipe! On cooler days and for holidays, this is PERFECT! (plus it makes your home smell heavenly!) I use a loose leaf tea strainer ball to put the small spices in, and just let the cinammon sticks float. Cook on low all day - sugar and spices can be adjusted for personal taste. Enjoy!
This was VERY easy to make (once you manage to hunt down cheesecloth.... found it in tool section!!). This will definitely be something I make every holiday season!! IT WAS A HIT!
Mine didn't look cloudy like the picture but it was fantastic. I only added about a tablespoon of brown sugar.
It was ok, nothing great!

Wow! Great cider (and so easy!!!). Made this tonight to go with the pumpkin pie I served for dessert at my family's "after Thanksgiving" dinner. This tastes just like apple pie. It IS sweet, so, if you do not care for sweet cider, this is not for you. My batch was EXTRA sweet because I decided to also add a 1/4 cup of honey (purchased in Antigua - West Indies good stuff!) and 1/2 t of vanilla extract (thanks Cher B for the great idea!). I was craving a sweet drink, not tart (like most traditional ciders are). My bf described this as "sweeter than apple juice"!!! My parents loved it. Altough I usually prepare a different cider recipe, I'll keep this one in my recipe file as well because it is quick to prepare, uses minimal ingredients and has that "apple pie" flavor that I love (my cider recipe does not - and takes much more effort to prepare). Thanks so much for sharing! I am drinking a mug of this right now : )
I combined this with the "hot apple cider" recipie and it was awesome. Everyone wanted the recipie. I will definately make this again
Delicious! I think I liked it cold even better. Used 1/4 cup sugar and added 1 tsp vanilla. Didn't have whole allspice so used a bit of ground. Great flavor, not too sweet or strong, just perfect!
I make it every winter to warm up. It's super easy and everyone LOVES it!! A tad on the sweet side, so I use 1/4C instead of 1/3C of brown sugar - which makes it perfect. Enjoy!
Easy and Yummy! We skip the sugar (no need) and brew it in a crock pot for 4 hours. Make sure to take the spices out after that or it gets too strong.
Awesome, just made it for my family tomorrow. Made a couple of adjustments, use apple juice,also add 1/3 cup of sugar, and 4 cinnamon sticks instead of 3 makes perfect cider!

I made this for afternoon visits with family before Christmas Dinner. We didn't find it too sweet. I just put in the cinnamon sticks and whole cloves loose, then scooped them out with a slotted spoon just before serving. And, we splashed in 1/2 - 3/4 cup Brandy which gave us all a nice, warm glow!

I followed this recipe as closely as I could, since I didn't have cinnamon sticks, I had to sub in ground cinnamon (1/2 tsp. = 1 stick). Still tastes delicious, and I think my guests will love it. The smell is WONDERFUL!! I also did as someone else suggested and used coffee filters tied with string instead of cheesecloth.
I love simple and good tasting recipes. This one hit the top of my list for fall beverages.
Quick, simple and tasty! I made this for my Halloween party and it smelled so good! Followed recipe as is and it disappeared!

It's difficult to feel harvest time festive in Florida when it's still 88 degrees outside. I served this wonderful cider cold with orange slices to girlfriends during a Halloween Make-up Party. Now we're waiting for a cold front so we can enjoy it warm. I served it with plain donuts that we fried together!

I liked this recipe. I added a small piece of vanilla bean and orange juice to the cider and cut back just a little on the brown sugar. I had 15 folks over for about 4 hours and they drank most of a large crockpot full. My son who is 7 years old loved it and wants me to keep making it all winter. Thanks for the recipe.

This was very good. I didn't have All Spice so looked up a substitute for it online and it said to use 1/3 tsp ground cloves, 1/3 tsp ground cinnamon, and 1/3 tsp of nutmeg for replacing 1 tsp of all spice. I did that and it turned out great.

The wonderful aroma greeted my chilled-to-the-bone guests wonderfully (they were returning from a very cold viewing of our town's Christmas parade), but it was a bit sweet. The adults loved it; the children were not impressed. Still, this is a keeper because it is so easy to make. I'll just cut down on the sugar next time. Thank you for an easy way to bring Christmas cheer to the home!

I multiplied this recipe for 70 people for my local Christmas Downtown Extravaganza. We warmed it over a propane burner. What a huge success!! The temperature was around 40 and the wind was blowing. People were walking up looking for that "delicious smell". I've already received several requests for the recipe. I will definitely make it again next year!! Thank you!
I made it for a bridal shower. Everybody loved it! I didn't think it was too sweet either.

I thought this was very good and not too sweet, although I have a somewhat stronger sweet tooth than many! You can put the cloves and allspice in a tea strainer (like you use for loose leaf tea by the cup) if you don't have cheesecloth.

The "I hate anything new" guys in my life(ages 3, 20ish, and 30ish) have judged this recipe a success. They say it tastes just like hot apple pie! I added about a tsp.of vanilla and about a 1/4 cup of honey for an even yummier taste. It tastes just like my Mom used to make when she'd bring those little cartons of mulling spices home.
Very good and easy to make. I made this for Thanksgiving and baptism and got a ton of compliments.
I thought this was good - but a little on the sweet side. I had to add some boiled water to the crock pot to water it down after tasting it. Next time, I'll definitely cut back on the brown sugar.

We decided to have a hospitality table at work for the Thanksgiving weekend. I found this recipe and after reading the other reviews I thought I would give it a go...WOW what a find we had customers walking through the store saying how good it was...thanks a million Jane for sharing this recipe it was a real life saver for me.

This apple cider recipe is the best that I have found. It is a great recipe, it's simple, easy and tastes great.I love to take the leftover cider, heat it up and enjoy a nice party with the family. I plan on usiing for Thanksgiving and I know that it will be a big hit. Thanks Jane
it's spicy and simple and hubby loves it too. i make this and then sit outside in a warm blankie with the hubby..great stuff.

I made this for my family over Thanksgiving and it was deemed "too sweet" by many. I added half the brown sugar called for and would suggest that if you try this recipe you add the sugar in portions to taste. The mulled spices smelled far better than the cider tasted.
Quick, easy and yummy. What more can you ask for?!
This was served at a party and boy did it go over well! Thanks, Jane, it was great, and very simple!
